text: 36 1/2 foot fifth-wheel tiny home for sale. This home is situated on a shaded lot in the San Gennaro Riverfront RV Park on the Colorado River in Bullhead City, Arizona. Amenities include access to the Colorado River by a private boat launch, beach, and dock. Views from the 8x20 deck give glimpses of the Spirit Mountain Wilderness and the Colorado River. The cozy, shaded back patio garden features a waterfall, a fire bowl, and a misting system. An 8x8 shed houses a washer, a dryer, and ample storage. Parking for two vehicles is provided in front of the home. The living area is surprisingly roomy due to the dual, opposing sliders. Laminate flooring has been installed throughout the home. Three recliners, a four-seat dinette, a built-in desk, and a free-standing china cabinet provide suitable accommodation. A residential mini-split heating and air conditioning system provides year-round comfort at a reasonable cost. The compact kitchen has a three-burner propane gas range and oven with an overhead microwave. A residential apartment-size refrigerator has 10 cubic feet of capacity. A hard-lined water filtration system treats the entire home. The bedroom/bathroom area has a respectable-sized shower, a small vanity, a large linen closet, and a residential flush toilet with a hard-lined sewer connection. The bed has a queen-size memory foam mattress on an adjustable frame with massage. A large hanging closet and built-in dresser with overhead cabinets give ample clothing storage. This tiny home has other unique owner-installed features that must be seen to be appreciated. Lot rent is currently $475/month, and the owner is responsible for paying propane and electricity. The electric bill has been under $50 during the cooler months and between $50 and $100 during the summer heat. After four years of comfortable living, the owners find it necessary to relocate. With the very reasonable asking price, this home is not likely to be on the market for long. Please call your agent for an appointment for a viewing.

Property is a Teardown being sold as-is for land value. Entry is at the visitors discretion and risk. Buyer and Buyer s Agent are responsible for independently verifying all information, including but not limited to zoning regulations, property boundaries, set-backs, utility costs and availability, sewer or septic systems, property access, tax obligations, flood zone status, city violations and any applicable assessments.
